title: Kievit/Milo Sans Alike
content:
This is terribly close to Kievit/Milo (or a mix of the too) but maybe there's something out there on their flavor. Anyone?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010231045im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kids_6498.png)
author: adriano

comments.content:
Freight Sans, no, unfortunately, that was my first thought too, but the /i/ in Freight Sans is angled at the top, and the questionmark is off.

Perhaps closer to [Foundry Sterling](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010231045/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/the-foundry-typefaces/sans/params/foundry-sterling/opentype/level-1/demi), but I'm not completely convinced.

> but the /i/ in Freight Sans is angled at the top, and the questionmark is off.

Good eyes! You're definitely right. /t bottom finial looks a bit off too. Foundry Sterling looks very close too, possibly matching (hard to tell with no type tester on Foundry's website). As usual, that's probably easier with a larger glyph set and the sample origin.

Ryuk and Ben,

Thanks for your time, it is indeed Sterling! ;)  
a,

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010231045im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sterling_4127.jpg)
Ah, just realised it's you Adriano! Hi! :-)
